pullrequest.title: load Utils.cmake again after calling find_package(ignition-cmake) to restore macros

content.raw:
I was talking to @caguero and it seems that `ign-transport4` may still be a work in progress? Another point of confusion is that ign-transport's default branch currently believes it is version 3, when it has actually diverged from ign-transport3 and something which builds against the default branch (like ign-gui's pipelines CI) might not work with 3.

I opened a couple of pull requests to ign-transport to try making sense of all this:

* [Accept both msgs0 and msgs1 on transport4](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/234/backport-pull-request-230-to-ign/diff)

* [Bump the default branch to version 5](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/235/bump-default-to-version-5/diff)
content.html:
I was talking to @caguero and it seems that ign-transport4 may still be a work in progress? Another point of confusion is that ign-transport's default branch currently believes it is version 3, when it has actually diverged from ign-transport3 and something which builds against the default branch (like ign-gui's pipelines CI) might not work with 3.

I opened a couple of pull requests to ign-transport to try making sense of all this:

  • Accept both msgs0 and msgs1 on transport4

  • Bump the default branch to version 5

content.html: so if you can find either transport3 or transport4, I think ign-gui will work again on homebrew

content.raw:
the ignition-gui formula was depending on `ignition-msgs1` and `ignition-transport3` (which itself depends on `ignition-msgs0`). I just updated the formula to depend instead of `ignition-transport4` instead:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/commit/76b8c6c7154d4e033f9df314c11fc0a2acbc6c50
content.html:
the ignition-gui formula was depending on ignition-msgs1 and ignition-transport3 (which itself depends on ignition-msgs0). I just updated the formula to depend instead of ignition-transport4 instead:

content.html: That explanation makes perfect sense. It's not clear to me though why Ubuntu finds the correct headers, but OSX doesn't.

pull_request.title: load Utils.cmake again after calling find_package(ignition-cmake) to restore macros

pullrequest.title: load Utils.cmake again after calling find_package(ignition-cmake) to restore macros

content.raw:
GeometryWidget.cc says to `#include <ignition/msgs/Utility.hh>`, which has:

~~~
#ifndef IGNITION_MSGS_UTILITY_HH_
#define IGNITION_MSGS_UTILITY_HH_
~~~

but there are two of those header files in the include path, so if it picks up the old one that doesn't have all the symbols, it will fail to compile

does that make sense? it's kinda complicated to explain
content.html:
GeometryWidget.cc says to #include <ignition/msgs/Utility.hh>, which has:

#ifndef IGNITION_MSGS_UTILITY_HH_
#define IGNITION_MSGS_UTILITY_HH_

but there are two of those header files in the include path, so if it picks up the old one that doesn't have all the symbols, it will fail to compile

does that make sense? it's kinda complicated to explain
